definition.text: The Netherlands is a constitutional monarchy in Western Europe known for its advanced, trade-oriented economy and long-standing maritime and commercial tradition. Historically central to early modern global trade and finance, it remains a major logistics and distribution hub within Europe, with strong sectors in agriculture, chemicals, high-tech manufacturing, and financial services.

works.title: Actor Set Evolution of the Netherlands
works.description: Temporal mapping of the Netherlandsâ€™ actor space from merchant republic institutions and chartered trading companies to modern parliamentary governance, multinational corporations, and EU-integrated regulatory bodies.

works.title: Trade and Logistics Network Structure
works.description: Network analysis of ports, shipping routes, distribution centers, and integration into European and global value chains.

works.title: Spatial and Water Management Structure
works.description: Geospatial representation of provinces, delta works, reclaimed land (polders), and infrastructure systems supporting flood control and urban-economic concentration.
